revised_title: Geomorphology and Marine Biology of the Solomon Islands Coral Reefs
tldr: The article discusses the results of the Royal Society expedition to the British Solomon Islands Protectorate in 1965, focusing on the geomorphology and marine biology of the coral reefs. The authors investigated various locations, including Tetel Island, Florida Group, Gizo Island, and Marau Sound, examining the geological background, contemporary reefs, and reef flats. The study provides insights into the complex interactions between tectonic movements, volcanic activity, and the formation of coral reefs in the region.
